posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
First of all, the OC and SoU are both supposed to start at level 1, and HotU is for the character who finished SoU. If you have you heart set on playing all 3 with the same character, play SoU, then the OC, and then HotU. It is still broken and a bad idea, but it is the least broken way to do it.

Here is a classic Halfling Bard 16 / Fighter 14 / RDD 10 build from 2006 that uses a bastard sword as a 2-hander. If that's not close enough, I would enjoy making a build for you.
http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 54146.html

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Oh yes..You can do a lot of things there, and if you are even remotely interested in playing with other people as well you will love it. Most Persistent Worlds today do not have even a fracture of the population they had in Neverwinter Night's Golden Age (2004-2010) but it is still much better than playing alone in my opinion. You don't need much, even one good companion can make a huge difference in your interest for the game, if the PW is build right. There are modules that can allow you to take your character close to level 40 as well, but very few are build right and the best ones with good storyline and such, are almost always end before level 30. If you need recommendations for both just ask,

This build has significantly lower AB and AC, but so many wonderful Rogue skills.
